page.title: 02CHURCHES OF EARDISLEY
page.content: The{church of St. Mary Magdalene}was begun in the 12th.century.It has a {Norman font}which is ornamented with elaborate carvings.Nowadays about 40-100 people attend regularly,most of them are old.Two services are held on Sundays either Holy Communion,Evensong or Family Services.The{Vicar}is also vicar of Witney,Willersley,Winforton, Brilley and Michaelchurch,but he lives in Almeley.There is a Sunday school of about 15 children.The church has a caretaker,organist and a choir of about 15.The church costs about Â£9000 a year to run.The money is raised by collections,fetes and sales.A group was formed in 1984 to help pay for the preservation of the fabric of the church.There are 6 bells rung regularly.There is also a{Methodist } chapel in the village with services held on alternate weeks .
